snippet: Jay Ungar and Molly Mason’s “Ashokan Farewell,” heard on Ken Burns’s Civil War series, helped preserve an area of the Catskill Mountains that inspired the song.
abstract: Olivebridge Journal; place in Catskill Mountains inspired fiddler Jay Ungar to write Ashokan Farewell, tune that filmmaker Ken Burns used as theme song for his Civil War series; notes that tune helped revive site, resulting in creation of the Ashokan Center, $7.25 million campus dedicated to traditional music, Catskill history, environmental education and local arts and crafts.
lead_paragraph: Jay Ungar and Molly Mason’s “Ashokan Farewell,” heard on Ken Burns’s Civil War series, helped preserve an area of the Catskill Mountains that inspired the song.

headline.seo: Song ‘Ashokan Farewell’ Saved Center in Catskills
headline.main: Catskill Cultural Center Saved, and Renewed, Thanks to a Fiddler’s Tune
headline.print_headline: Catskill Cultural Center Saved and Renewed, Thanks to a Fiddler’s Plaintive Tune
